title.narrative: F.a: Life, Dignity, and Justice for the Peoples of Central America

description.narrative: The project aims at contributing towards the reduction of the causes of vulnerability in Central America, implementing innovative rights based actions within the framework of a comprehensive sustainable development action. The program is implemented by Lut heran World Federation Central America in four Central American states: Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador and Nicaragua. Finn Church Aid supports the regional as well as the Guatemala and Honduras components. Project activities include1) Support the agricul tural production of the small farmers, commercialization of products and advocacy work at local, regional and national levels.2) Environmental protection3) Democratic leadership: Peasant communities and CBO's organisational capacity-building, with special attention to empowerment and ownership of women and youth.4) Social policies: Peasant communities and local organisations strengthened in their capacities related to advocacy work, especially related to the agriculture policy (eg. land right questions) at the municipal level. Special focus on social security, security in general and human rights related themes.5) Natural disaster prevention and preparedness.Rights-holders /beneficiaries: Most vulnerable, marginalised, and impoverished communities, especiall y those facing citizen insecurity, mainly characterised by drug trafficking or organised crime. Priority will also be given to persons displaced by monoculture production and extractive industries, agrarian conflict, inadequate land distribution, and recur ring hazards. Special focus is given to women, youth and indigenous people. Also community leaders and human rights defenders are targeted.
